captions.text:
BRIAN! SLOW DOWN
IN THE HALLWAY!

GOT A TELEGRAM
FROM MY MOM.

MEETIN' MY MOM
AT THE BUS STOP.

WE STILL ON
FOR THAT THING TODAY?

HEY, BRIAN, YOU STILL UP
FOR THAT THING LATER?

OH, CRAP, THAT THING
THAT WAS TODAY?

I'VE GOT ANOTHER THING
WITH JENNY.

AWESOME. WE'LL HANG OUT
TOMORROW, ALL RIGHT?

MY MOM'S COMING TO VISIT,
AND I HAVEN'T HEARD FROM HER
SINCE I LEFT FOR VGHS.

BUT IF YOU NEED
MORE TIME TO REVIEW...

BUT SERIOUSLY,
I'M GONNA GO NOW,

AND THEN IN TWO AND A HALF
MINUTES, YOU CAN--

YOU'RE KIND OF FREAKIN' OUT
ABOUT THIS, AREN'T YOU?

FREAKING OUT?
I'M NOT FREAKING OUT.
YOU'RE FREAKING--

DUDE, CHILL. THIS IS
SUPPOSED TO BE FUN.

YOU'RE RIGHT.
I'M SORRY.
I'M JUST...

YOUR MOM CAN'T
FIND OUT ABOUT US.

I MEAN, NOBODY CAN
FIND OUT ABOUT US,
AND THIS IS FOR REAL NOW.

I'M JUST-- I'M AFRAID
I'M GONNA BLOW IT.

BRIAN, DISARM THE BOMB.
IT'S GONNA BLOW.

CAN'T DISARM A BOMB.
I CAN DISARM A BOMB.

ANY PRO SHOULD BE ABLE
TO DO IT BLINDFOLDED.

COACH, I-I SWEAR I CAN
NORMALLY DO THIS.

ON THAT UPLIFTING NOTE,
THAT'S PRACTICE.

SO, ABOUT BRIAN,
WHAT DO YOU THINK?

I THINK HE'S STILL
IN THE ROOM, MOM.

( chuckles )
SEE YA WHEN I SEE YA.

I WANT TO BENCH
BRIAN TOMORROW.

YOU'RE MY CAPTAIN.
I WANT TO HEAR YOUR OPINION.

WELL, HE'S ONE OF
THE STRONGEST PLAYERS
IN OUR TEAM.

I WOULDN'T BENCH HIM
JUST BECAUSE HE

GUYS LIKE BRIAN ARE ALL TALENT
AND NO DISCIPLINE.

IT SHOWS UP
IN STUFF LIKE THIS.

ONE STUPID BOMB
COULD MAKE US LOSE
THE GAME TOMORROW.

YEAH. IT SOUNDS LIKE
YOU'VE MADE UP YOUR MIND.

I'LL TELL YOU WHAT:
YOU MAKE THE CALL.

BENCH HIM OR NOT.
JUST LET ME KNOW
BY GAME TIME.

WENDELL. RULE NUMBER FIVE.
NO SODAS IN THE HALLWAY.

NO THROWING TRASH
IN THE HALLWAYS.

D'OH! I--
IT WAS AN ACCIDENT.

UNFORTUNATELY, I CAUGHT YOU
WITH SILLY STRING EARLIER.

I'M SORRY,
BUT RULES ARE RULES.

THOUGH I THINK NUMBER TWO
WOULD BE MORE APPROPRIATE!

- OH, MY GOSH.
- SCOOPED THIS OFF YOUR FLOOR
A COUPLE MINUTES AGO.

THIS ISN'T
JUST SOME NORMAL POOP

LIKE ONE OF THE STUDENTS
MIGHT LEAVE. OH, NO.

IN FACT, I'M WILLING
TO BET IT CAME FROM A...

POOPIE MAN SHANE!
POOPIE MAN SHANE!

SO WHEN I FIND THAT CAT,
YOU CAN SAY GOODBYE
TO NUMBER ONE,

'CAUSE SHE'S COMING OVER
TO MY PLACE.

WE'RE MOVING IN TOGETHER,
ME AND ONE.

MY FRIENDS SAY
I'M ONE-WHIPPED,
BUT I DON'T CARE,

WHAT THE HECK IS WRONG
WITH YOU, TED?

GOD! I'VE BEEN HOLDING
THIS TRACK FOR HOURS.
WHEN DO I GET THE TOY CAR?
THIS IS NOT A TOY, TED.

THIS IS A CUSTOM OVERDRIFT
USB SUPERCAR.

WHAT? I WANT ONE
EVEN MORE NOW.

D.K.,
WHEN DO I GET ONE?

THEODORE, YOU'VE
BEEN A DRIFTER FOR
NARY A FORTMONTH.

EARNING A SUPERCAR
IS NO SMALL CHALLENGE.

IT'S ONLY FOR
SUPER SERIOUS RACERS.

I STOLE SODA FOR YOU GUYS.
I BEAT THE DUCHESS.
AND I BUILT THIS BOSS TRACK.

AND ALL MY
FRIENDS HAVE ONE,
AND I WANT ONE. NOW.

IF YOU WILL NOT
HEED MY WARNING,

GO GRAB A BOOK
FROM THE BOOKSHELF.

I KNOW YOU MISSED ME
BECAUSE I MISSED
YOU TOO, BUDDY.

BUT DAD'S GOTTA GO
NOW TO PRACTICE
HIS STUPID MINIGAME,

A MINIGAME THAT IF
HE MESSES UP, WILL RUIN
OUR ENTIRE SEASON.

YOU HAVE A CAT
IN YOUR ROOM.

OH, YEAH, THAT'S CHEETO,
MY BEST BUD FROM HOME.

CHEETO, THIS IS KI.
SHE'S AWESOME.

ALL RIGHT,
WELL, I GOTTA GO.

ARE THE CAT THAT'S BEEN
POOPING ON MY FLOOR?

DESIGNED BY THE ZEN
DRIFTING MONKS

IT REMAINS THE MOST EXTREME
OVERDRIFT GAME EVER CONCEIVED.

SHOULD A PLAYER
BE BRAVE ENOUGH,

TO TAME ONE OF THE WILD
SUPERCARS WITHIN,

PURGATORIO
SHALL GRANT HIM A JEWEL

IN THEIR MAD DREAMS
TO CONSTRUCT THE ULTIMATE RACER,

THE DRIFT MONKS INSTALLED
A FEATURE WAY TOO HARDCORE

YOU SEE, WHEN YOU
ENTER PURGATORIO,

YOU CANNOT LEAVE
UNTIL YOU WIN.

THEY SAY ONE KID GOT TRAPPED
IN THERE FOR THREE DAYS.

I HEARD ANOTHER KID
PEED HIS PANTS.

ALL THOSE LEGENDS ARE
BOTH TRUE AND UNTRUE,

EXCEPT FOR THE ONE
WHERE THE KID DIED.

THAT'S WHY
THEY BANNED THE GAME

UNTIL I FOUND A COPY...
ON EBAY.

SO, THEODORE, NOW THAT
YOU'VE HEARD THE TALE,

DID YOU GO
TO THE BATHROOM FIRST?

COME ON, YOU'VE DONE THIS
A THOUSAND TIMES.

ALL RIGHT.
NO MORE SCREWING AROUND.

HE'S BEEN IN THERE
FOR HOURS, D.K.

WERE YOU READY, TRIXI?
WERE ANY OF US?

( whispering )
I THOUGHT THEY
PATCHED HER OUT.

A CRUEL JOKE
PROGRAMMED BY THE MONKS

AT THE HEIGHT
OF THEIR MADNESS.

NO WAY YOU'RE GETTING PAST ME
WITHOUT A RACE, BUDDY.

HELLO, UM,
DO YOU WANT ME TO DO
THE GIRLS' BATHROOM TOO,
HO, IS... IS THAT A CAT?

YES, UH, YES IT IS...
A CAT.

WHY WOULD YOU HAVE A CAT?
YOU'RE BREAKING, UH, RULE...
YOU'RE BREAKING RULE 35.

WELL, YOU SEE,
THAT'S NOT ENTIRELY TRUE.

I AM THE R.A.,
AND I JUST TRAINED...

THAT'S WHAT YOU--
THAT'S WHAT YOU SAID.

- YOU SAID RULES ARE RULES.
- WENDELL, CONTROL
YOUR BREATHING.

NO, NO! YOU'RE
BREAKING THE RULES, KI.

I'M NOT GONNA LISTEN
TO ANYTHING YOU SAY
ANYMORE, OKAY?

KI IS HOUSING A CAT.
SHE'S BREAKING THE RULES!

NO! NO, NO, NO,
NO, NO, NO!

WENDELL, CAN I SEE YOU
IN TED'S--?

THEY'RE JUST A LIE.
NOTHING IS REAL.

GOOD. WELL,
IN THAT CASE, WANNA GO?

YOU KNOW, ACTUALLY,
I THINK I MAY JUST STAY

LIKE, FOR TOMORROW,
YOU'VE GOT THE WHOLE
BOMB THING DOWN?

YEAH, YEAH.
NO. ALL THE WAY DOWN.

'CAUSE BRIAN, IF YOU DON'T,
I REALLY NEED TO KNOW THAT.

NO, NO, NO.
JENNY, YEAH, I, UH...

YOU KNOW WHAT? I'VE BEEN
AT THIS FOR, LIKE, HOURS,

SO, WHY DON'T WE GO
GRAB A BITE TO EAT?

SEE YOU IN THE CLOSET
IN FIVE.

WELL, GIRL,
YOU ARE PRETTY CRAZY.

COME ON, D.K.
WE'LL PRY HIM OUT
IN THE MORNING.

RULES ARE RULES.
THAT MEANS NO PETS.

I CAN'T DO IT.
I CAN'T DISARM A BOMB.

WHAT? YOU SAID
THAT YOU COULD.

I TOLD MY MOM
THAT YOU COULD DO IT.
SHE WANTED TO BENCH YOU.

- WELL, I CAN'T.
SHE PROBABLY SHOULD.
- NO, NO, NO. IT'S FINE.

YOU'LL JUST DO
YOUR BRIAN THING,
AND IT'LL ALL--

NO, JENNY,
I CAN'T DO IT.

I COULDN'T DO IT
ALL AFTERNOON.

I DON'T KNOW WHY,
I JUST-- I CAN'T.

I'M GONNA HAVE TO PUT
SOMEBODY ELSE IN.

LOOK, JUST...
NEXT TIME DON'T LIE
TO ME ABOUT IT, OKAY?
WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?

AND I HOPE YOU CRASH,
YOU PIECE OF JUNK.

YOU HEARD WHAT I SAID.
GO AWAY!

I'M SORRY I THREW YOU
OUT THERE EARLIER.
LET'S GET YOU HOME TO BRIAN.

MAN, CATS ARE REALLY
EASY TO GRAB, AM I RIGHT?

WELL, IT'S TIME
TO GET YOU IN TROUBLE.

YOU'RE A BUSINESSMAN.
I'M SURE WE CAN
WORK THIS OUT.

THOSE GUYS BEING MEAN
TO YOU BACK THERE?
LOOK, DO YOU WANT TO RACE?

I'M GONNA BE STUCK HERE
FOR A WHILE, SO...

OKAY, HEY, NO FAIR
STARTING WITHOUT ME.
WHOA, WHAT--? HEY!

HEADS UP.
IT'S THE FINAL ROUND.

VGHS HAS ONE LAST CHANCE
TO DISARM THE BOMB

- SORRY, COACH.
- I DON'T NEED SORRY.

I NEED YOU
TO GET IT TOGETHER.
THIS IS THE FINAL ROUND, GUYS.

THEY ARE ADAPTING AND
NAILING US TO THE WALL.

I NEED TO THROW THEM
A CURVE BALL.

I KNOW
HE MAY BE UNDISCIPLINED,
HE STEPS UP TO THE PLATE.

COACH, WITH
EVEN MORE DUE RESPECT,

YEAH, THE DEANSTER
MAY HAVE FAILED
TO COVER JENNY,

BUT WHEN
THE GOING GETS TOUGH,
THE DEANSTER GETS--

NO CAN DO.
IT'S OUT OF RANGE.

ALSO, WHO'S THIS LAW FELLER
Y'ALL TALKIN' ABOUT?

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN IT GOES
OUT OF RANGE, LAW?

WELL, IT'S JUST YOU
AND ME NOW, JACKS.

OKAY. I'M GONNA GO STAND UP
NOW, DISARM THE BOMB.

REALLY? THINK I'M GONNA
FALL FOR THAT AGAIN?

AND THAT'S HOW I GOT CHEETO
TO BECOME THE SCHOOL MASCOT.

OKAY, FIRST I WOKE UP.
NO, WAIT, GO BACK.

FIRST I WAS ASLEEP,
AND THEN I WOKE UP,

AND THEN I WENT
TO PURGATORIO!

DUDE, IT IS ONLY THE SICKEST,
RADDEST, MOST--

The Law: ( muffled )
BETTER CALL WHO?

SORRY, MAN,
I'LL LET YOU
GET BACK TO THAT.

NO PROBLEM. BY THE WAY,
IT'S "BETTER CALL WHOM?"

HE WAS WRONG.
IT'S "BETTER CALL WHO?"

NO, NO!
I DON'T NEED ANYBODY!

title: Video Game High School (VGHS) - S2: Ep. 4
